intro: Chamomilla praecox, commonly known as German chamomile, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features finely divided, aromatic leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant is widely cultivated for its medicinal properties, particularly for its calming and anti-inflammatory effects. Its essential oil, derived from the flowering tops, contains compounds like bisabolol and chamazulene. Chamomilla praecox thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it a popular choice for both ornamental and therapeutic gardening.
